2015-2016 Stevenson National Honor Society Application (Due 3-4, 11:59 PM)

READ THE FOLLOWING BEFORE FILLING OUT ANY PART OF THE APPLICATION!!!
THE SELECTION PROCESS

1) Letters are sent to sophomore and junior candidates who meet the scholarship requirement of 3.9000 cumulative GPA or above.
2) Scholarship: Sophomore and Junior students with a 3.9000 cumulative GPA or above are invited for selection. This is the only scholarship requirement in accordance with the National Constitution.
3) Character: All Stevenson faculty members are asked to evaluate a candidate’s character on a scale of 1-5. Candidates must score a 3.5 average or higher.
4) Service and Leadership: A Faculty Council, selected by the principal, evaluates the student submissions for leadership and service hours (20 hours needed in each category).

IT IS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED TO SUBMIT MORE THAN 20 HOURS IN EACH CATEGORY FROM A VARIETY OF SOURCES
IN CASE FACULTY COUNCIL DOES NOT ACCEPT SOME OF THEM.

THERE ARE A MAXIMUM OF 6 ENTRIES POSSIBLE EACH FOR SERVICE & LEADERSHIP, SO IT IS BEST TO PICK EXAMPLES WITH MORE HOURS. THE FIELDS FOR SERVICE APPEAR FIRST IN THIS FORM, THE FIELDS FOR LEADERSHIP APPEAR NEAR THE END OF THIS FORM.

How will faculty council evaluate your LEADERSHIP hours? Here are the criteria:

-The activity or activities placed you in a position of special responsibility (example: committee head, directing planning of event, etc.)
-The role required you to facilitate effective communication between individuals and/or groups.
-The role required you and your group to set a goal and create an action plan to achieve it.

How will faculty council evaluate SERVICE hours? Here are the criteria:

-Service activities are done on behalf of others (not including immediate family members.)
-No compensation (grade, class credit, monetary or other) has been given.
-Service activities must be done outside the school day or during unscheduled time.
-The primary intent of the activity is to aid and assist others for the good of the community.

5) Faculty council will review all submissions. Service & Leadership hours will be verified through phone calls and email. Any inaccurate or misleading submissions will give faculty council grounds for denial of admittance.

6) After checking accuracy of submissions, faculty council will accept or deny leadership and service hours.
7) Students who have met the criteria for service, leadership, and character will be sent letters notifying them of acceptance.
8) Sophomores who are not selected have the opportunity to reapply next year provided that their cumulative GPA remains a 3.9000 or above.

If accepted for membership in the National Honor Society, you attest to the following MEMBERSHIP REQUIREMENTS:

1) You will participate in the monthly meetings.
2) You will participate in all National Honor Society service projects.
3) You will accumulate 10 hours of community service per semester.
4) You will not let my grade point average dip below a cumulative 3.9000 GPA on a weighted scale.
5) You will abide by all school rules, local, state, and federal laws.
6) You understand that failure in any of the above areas is grounds for removal from National Honor Society.

If you have any questions about the entire selection process, please email Mr. Erdmann at berdmann@d125.org

Service Hour Submission #2 (Description)
Give date(s)/brief description of activity or group of related activities (3 sentence maximum). Explain how activity (or activities) meet(s) service criteria from top of this form.
I have volunteered with the school band at Bernie’s Book Bank on April 25, 2014 and February 27, 2015, where we help sort and sticker gently used books to give to at-risk children in the Chicagoland area. The goal is to help raise a new generation of kids who, with books, can get a better education than they would growing up without being able to read for fun.

Leadership Hour Submission #1 (Description)
Give date(s)/brief description of activity or group of related activities (3 sentence maximum). Explain how activity (or activities) meet(s) leadership criteria from top of this form.
As Director of Technology on the executive board for the WYSE (Worldwide Youth in Science and Engineering) club at Stevenson High School, I am responsible for leading weekly meetings for the club alongside other members of the e-board where we discuss competition strategies and prepare for upcoming competitions, forming goals for test scores to aid us in said preparation. I am also responsible for organizing club events alongside the e-board, especially in maintaining contact with club members through e-mail and our facebook group and compiling and formatting exams for events. Past events include a middle school competition, where middle schoolers from feeder schools such as Daniel Wright and Twin Groves competed in a multiple choice test, a written report, and a boat-building event, as well as an invitational with Buffalo Grove High School and Glenbrook North High School held at SHS.

Leadership Hour Submission #2 (Description)
Give date(s)/brief description of activity or group of related activities (3 sentence maximum). Explain how activity (or activities) meet(s) leadership criteria from top of this form.
I was a class leader for the SHS Give-A-Thon, where classes can raise money to donate gifts to families in need for Christmas, donate canned goods to stock the Vernon Area Pantry, and donate young motherhood items the Lake County Public Action to Deliver Shelter program. As class leader, I sold goods such as cookies in class and in my other classes to raise money to purchase gifts for the family our class was assigned, alongside my two other class leaders. With my other class leaders, I also rallied the class to donate money and goods, forming goals for how much money and goods the class should donate.

Leadership Hour Submission #3 (Description)
Give date(s)/brief description of activity or group of related activities (3 sentence maximum). Explain how activity (or activities) meet(s) leadership criteria from top of this form.
I organized a group of musicians to play repertoire at the Adlai E. Stevenson II Historic Home at its dedication as a National Landmark before the dedication ceremony. Forming a goal for the level of mastery the group should have over the repertoire before performing at the home, I organized repertoire and pieces for the group to play, as well as organized practice time for the group.
